citations.narrative:
Three instances of patrons interacting with animals without an attendant present were observed during this inspection.
-Two groups of patrons were observed interacting with the animals in the petting zoo area containing goats, alpacas, zebu
and donkeys.
-One group of patrons was observed interacting with the adult giraffe in the back area where a sufficient barrier was not in
place to prevent this interaction.
Allowing patrons to have direct public contact with animals without having an attendant present puts both the animals and
the public at risk of harm or injury. The regulations state that a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable
employee or attendant must be present at all times during periods of public contact. Correct by May 19, 2023.

The elevated wood plank platform in the caracal enclosure has multiple warped boards, allowing the platform to be
unstable and serve as a paw entrapment area if the caracals try to use this platform to reach the elevated den area.
Unstable platforms can allow the animals to be injured. The regulations state that the outdoor housing facilities shall be
structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

Several enclosures exhibited signs of insufficient cleaning and sanitization.
--The enclosure housing 3 African Crested Porcupines and 4 prairie dogs exhibited a lack of adequate sanitation. The
concrete floor was covered by about a 1/4 inch of grimey build-up and debris, the walls were unclean, and the two feed
troughs were coated with brown buildup and contained wilted vegetables. The employee indicated that the food was left
over from the day before.
--The enclosure housing two giant anteaters had multiple areas coated in brown debris, including the floor and walls.
--The area in the giraffe enclosure where the giraffes stick their heads through to engage with patrons showed evidence
of brown build-up and grime.
Not conducting effective daily cleaning can lead to build up of material that can promote disease-causing organisms and
allow pests to proliferate. The regulations state that excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as
necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce
odors.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.131(d)(2) 
   
Handling of animals. 
Three instances of patrons interacting with animals without an attendant present were observed during this inspection.  
-Two groups of patrons were observed interacting with the animals in the petting zoo area containing goats, alpacas, zebu 
and donkeys.  
-One group of patrons was observed interacting with the adult giraffe in the back area where a sufficient barrier was not in 
place to prevent this interaction.  
Allowing patrons to have direct public contact with animals without having an attendant present puts both the animals and 
the public at risk of harm or injury. The regulations state that a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable 
employee or attendant must be present at all times during periods of public contact. Correct by May 19, 2023. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
The elevated wood plank platform in the caracal enclosure has multiple warped boards, allowing the platform to be 
unstable and serve as a paw entrapment area if the caracals try to use this platform to reach the elevated den area.  
Unstable platforms can allow the animals to be injured. The regulations state that the outdoor housing facilities shall be 
structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

3.131(a)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
Several enclosures exhibited signs of insufficient cleaning and sanitization.  
--The enclosure housing 3 African Crested Porcupines and 4 prairie dogs exhibited a lack of adequate sanitation. The 
concrete floor was covered by about a 1/4 inch of grimey build-up and debris, the walls were unclean, and the two feed 
troughs were coated with brown buildup and contained wilted vegetables. The employee indicated that the food was left 
over from the day before.   
--The enclosure housing two giant anteaters had multiple areas coated in brown debris, including the floor and walls.  
--The area in the giraffe enclosure where the giraffes stick their heads through to engage with patrons showed evidence 
of brown build-up and grime.  
Not conducting effective daily cleaning can lead to build up of material that can promote disease-causing organisms and 
allow pests to proliferate.  The regulations state that excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as 
necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce 
odors. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
